snippet: The vote came a year after a Department of Justice policy indicated tribes could grow and sell marijuana under the same guidelines as states that opt to legalize.
abstract: Confederated Tribes of Warm Springs in Oregon overwhelmingly approves plan to grow and sell marijuana to tribe-owned stores outside reservation; move comes year after Dept of Justice policy indicated tribes could grow and sell marijuana under same guidelines followed by states that opt to legalize.
lead_paragraph: The vote came a year after a Department of Justice policy indicated tribes could grow and sell marijuana under the same guidelines as states that opt to legalize.

headline.main: Native American Tribes Approve Plan to Grow and Sell Marijuana in Oregon
headline.print_headline: Oregon Tribes Approve Plan to Grow and Sell Pot
